---
title: "Example trackdown doc"
output: 
  bookdown::word_document2
---

```{r r-chunk-options, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# 
rm(list=ls())

# WorkingDir = getwd()
# HomeFile = getwd()
HomeFile = "C:/Users/nick.tolimieri/Desktop/IEA-Test"
           

library(knitr) 
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  root.dir = HomeFile,
  fig.path = paste0(HomeFile,'/Figures/'),
  #fig.path = paste0(HomeFile,'/Figures_JPGs/'),
  # fig.path = paste0(HomeFile,'/TechMemoFigs/'),
  cache.path = 'cache/graphics-', 
  echo=FALSE,
  include = TRUE,
  # dev='jpeg',
  dev='png',
  dpi=300,
  warning=FALSE
  )

fig.loc = paste0(HomeFile,'/Figures/')
text.loc = paste0(HomeFile,'/Text_Files/')
```

```{r upload.download, eval=FALSE}

# I added these commands here for convenience. Don't run them as part of the rmd (hence eval=FALSE)
# They upload, update, and download the rmd file to the google drive.  
# there are other options render and add both the rmd and docx (or pdf file) at the same time.


trackdown::upload_file(file = paste0(HomeFile,"/test.code.Rmd"),
                       gpath = "_00_IEA-TEST/", hide_code = TRUE)
 
trackdown::update_file(file = paste0(HomeFile,"/test.code.Rmd"), 
                        gpath = "_00_IEA-TEST/", hide_code = TRUE)
 
trackdown::download_file(file = paste0(HomeFile,"/test.code.Rmd"),
                          gpath = "_00_IEA-TEST/")

```
